page.title: 14A Dairy Farm
page.content: Gellyhill Farm is a dairy farm. Altogether the farm has got two hundred and seventy British Friesian cows. The cows are milked twice a day, at half past four in the morning and at three o'clock in the afternoon. Gellyhill Farm has a milking parlour, which can milk twenty one cows at one time. The milking parlour is different to most because it rotates and when one turn is made the cow that has gone round once should have finished being milked. When the cow goes onto the machine there is a feeding chute which gives it some food to eat as it goes round the turnstile. The total acreage of Gellyhill Farm is five hundred acres. The owners, one family, have several other farms in the Banff area.They own almost 50% of the land in this D-Block.
